de.charite.compbio.jannovar.impl.parse

Class UCSCParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.charite.compbio.jannovar.impl.parse.UCSCParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TranscriptParser

    public class UCSCParser
extends Object
implements TranscriptParser
    Parser for the UCCSC knownGene and related files. Parses the four files from the UCSC database relating the KnownGenes. The main file, knownGene.txt, is tab-separated and has the following fields:
    1. `name` e.g., uc001irt.4. This is a UCSC knownGene identifier. We will use the kgXref table to convert to gene symbol etc.
    2. `chrom` e.g., chr10
    3. `strand` e.g., +
    4. `txStart` e.g., 24497719
    5. `txEnd` e.g., 24836772
    6. `cdsStart` e.g., 24498122
    7. `cdsEnd` e.g., 24835253
    8. `exonCount` e.g., 17
    9. `exonStarts` e.g., 24497719,24508554,24669797,.... (total of 17 ints for this example)
    10. `exonEnds` e.g., 24498192,24508838,24669996, .... (total of 17 ints for this example)
    11. `proteinID` e.g., NP_001091971
    12. `alignID` e.g., uc001irt.4 (Note: We do not need this field for our app).
    Note that this file is a MySQL dump file used at the UCSC database. We will use this program to create a serialized java object that can quickly be input to the Jannovar program. This class additionally parses the ucsc KnownToLocusLink.txt file, which contains cross references from the ucsc IDs to the corresponding Entrez Gene ids (earlier known as Locus Link): 
     uc010eve.3      3805
 uc002qug.4      3805
 uc010evf.3      3805
 ...
    The class additionally parses the files knownGeneMrna.txt and kgXref.txt. The result of parsing is the creation of a list of TranscriptModel objects. It is possible to parse directly from the gzip file without decompressing them, or the start from the decompressed files. The class checks of the files exist and if they have the suffix "gz". *
    Author:
    Peter N Robinson, Manuel Holtgrewe, Max Schubach

      • parseTranscriptModelFromLine

        public TranscriptModelBuilder parseTranscriptModelFromLine(String line)
                                                    throws TranscriptParseException
        The function parses a single line of the knownGene.txt file. The fields of the file are tab separated and have the following structure:
        • 0: name (UCSC known gene id, e.g., "uc021olp.1"
        • 1: chromosome, e.g., "chr1"
        • 2: strand, e.g., "-"
        • 3: transcription start, e.g., "38674705"
        • 4: transcription end, e.g., "38680439"
        • 5: CDS start, e.g., "38677458"
        • 6: CDS end, e.g., "38678111"
        • 7: exon count, e.g., "4"
        • 8: exonstarts, e.g., "38674705,38677405,38677769,38680388,"
        • 9: exonends, e.g., "38676494,38677494,38678123,38680439,"
        • 10: name, again (?), e.g., "uc021olp.1"
        The function additionally parses the start and end of the exons. Note that in the UCSC database, positions are represented using half-open, zero-based coordinates. That is, if start is 2 and end is 7, then the first nucleotide is at position 3 (one-based) and the last nucleotide is at positon 7 (one-based). For now, we are switching the coordinates to fully-closed one based by incrementing all start positions by one. This is the way coordinates are typically represented in VCF files and is the way coordinate calculations are done in annovar. At a later date, it may be worthwhile to switch to the UCSC-way of half-open zero based coordinates.
        Parameters:
        line - A single line of the UCSC knownGene.txt file
        Returns:
        TranscriptModelBuilder representing the line
        Throws:
        TranscriptParseException - on problems parsing the data
